taskDescription: Log into ALFRED’s caregiver dashboard to monitor patient health data
Configure my ALFRED interface to block all non-emergency alerts during work hours
Attempt to adjust patient notification preferences remotely to silence non-urgent prompts
Schedule video check-ins with patients to review their health status
Filter alerts to focus only on clinically relevant notifications during work
Express frustration when non-critical notifications distract me during clinical tasks
Wish the system would force patients to wear sensors and accept only critical alerts

Feel annoyed when patients are engaged in non-medical activities during visits
Balance care efficiency needs with respecting patient autonomy in notification settings
Respect clients’ wishes for offline, home-based check-ins
Prefer online video check-ins but adapt to user preferences
Feel constrained by limited data due to privacy restrictions
Find formal communication style cumbersome for urgent exchanges

Balance need for fuller data access with respecting privacy settings
